lidarr.eli5: Lidarr is like a smart robot that finds and organizes all your favorite music automatically.
lidarr.boss: Lidarr is an automated music collection manager that downloads, renames, and organizes music files from various sources.
lidarr.sysadmin: Lidarr uses indexers and download clients to automate the search, download, and sorting of music albums, integrating with music libraries.
lidarr.use_case: Used to automatically download and organize new albums from preferred artists.

bazarr.eli5: Bazarr is like a helper who finds and adds subtitles to your movies and shows.
bazarr.boss: Bazarr is a subtitle management tool that automates the downloading of subtitles for media libraries.
bazarr.sysadmin: Bazarr integrates with Radarr and Sonarr to search for and sync subtitles from providers like OpenSubtitles and Subscene.
bazarr.use_case: Used to keep subtitle files in sync for multilingual movie libraries.

qbittorrent.eli5: qBittorrent is like a library card that lets you download books from many people at once.
qbittorrent.boss: qBittorrent is a free and open-source BitTorrent client used to download files via peer-to-peer sharing.
qbittorrent.sysadmin: qBittorrent supports magnet links, RSS feeds, and remote control via Web UI and is often integrated with automation tools.
qbittorrent.use_case: Used to download Linux ISOs or media files using magnet links.

deluge.eli5: Deluge is another app that helps you collect files from others, like passing notes in class.
deluge.boss: Deluge is a lightweight, cross-platform BitTorrent client known for its modular plugin support.
deluge.sysadmin: Deluge can run in headless server mode with remote control, supports magnet links, and integrates with automation tools like Sonarr.
deluge.use_case: Used as a low-resource torrent client on a Raspberry Pi or server.

rtorrent.eli5: rTorrent is a super-efficient tool for downloading files from lots of people, but it looks old-school.
rtorrent.boss: rTorrent is a terminal-based BitTorrent client optimized for performance and remote automation.
rtorrent.sysadmin: rTorrent is a high-performance BitTorrent client often used with ruTorrent (web UI) and paired with automation tools in headless setups.
rtorrent.use_case: Used on seedboxes and remote servers for torrenting via terminal.

nzbget.eli5: NZBGet is like a robot that grabs puzzle pieces from Usenet and builds your file.
nzbget.boss: NZBGet is a Usenet downloader optimized for performance, often used in automated media pipelines.
nzbget.sysadmin: NZBGet downloads files using NZB files from Usenet servers, featuring low memory usage and integration with tools like Sonarr.
nzbget.use_case: Used to fetch TV episodes from Usenet for Sonarr automation.

sabnzbd.eli5: SABnzbd is another robot that picks up Usenet files and puts them together for you.
sabnzbd.boss: SABnzbd is a web-based Usenet downloader that automates the unpacking and cleanup process.
sabnzbd.sysadmin: SABnzbd handles NZB downloads, repair (PAR2), and extraction (RAR) from Usenet; integrates with Sonarr, Radarr, and Lidarr.
sabnzbd.use_case: Used to process automated downloads of TV shows through Radarr.

jackett.eli5: Jackett is like a librarian who helps apps search lots of torrent sites at once.
jackett.boss: Jackett acts as a search translator, letting apps like Sonarr find torrents across many indexers.
jackett.sysadmin: Jackett serves as a proxy for torrent indexers, converting their search formats into a standardized API that apps can query.
jackett.use_case: Used to connect Sonarr to public torrent trackers for episode downloads.

ombi.eli5: Ombi is like a wishlist app for your media server—you ask it for stuff and it fetches it.
ombi.boss: Ombi provides a user-friendly request system for media servers, allowing users to suggest and track downloads.
ombi.sysadmin: Ombi integrates with Plex, Sonarr, Radarr, and Lidarr to allow authenticated users to request media via web interface.
ombi.use_case: Used to let family members request movies for the home Plex server.

tautulli.eli5: Tautulli is like a report card for your movie server—who watched what and when.
tautulli.boss: Tautulli provides analytics and notifications for Plex, helping admins track usage and performance.
tautulli.sysadmin: Tautulli monitors Plex Media Server activity and provides detailed stats, email alerts, and integration hooks.
tautulli.use_case: Used to notify when new users watch a movie or when buffering occurs.
